text: has anyone ever had this happen to them:  attempting to replace a cpu cooler fan, I released the mounting brackets but the thermal paste was so sticky that when I pulled the fan out it didn't detach from the cpu, it pulled the CPU out of the socket with the fan--pulling all the pins out of the locked CPU socket.  Amazingly all the pins look fine

elements.text: has anyone ever had this happen to them:  attempting to replace a cpu cooler fan, I released the mounting brackets but the thermal paste was so sticky that when I pulled the fan out it didn't detach from the cpu, it pulled the CPU out of the socket with the fan--pulling all the pins out of the locked CPU socket.  Amazingly all the pins look fine

text: yep this happened to me a few times. I was terrified the first time but it didn't seem to damage anything.

elements.text: yep this happened to me a few times. I was terrified the first time but it didn't seem to damage anything.

text: shouldn't the CPU have a clamp seperate from the cooler..?

elements.text: shouldn't the CPU have a clamp seperate from the cooler..?

text: it does but the clamp is apparently not that strong.. that is fortunate because I can imagine that the pins might be the next point of failure
